subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Neuromuscular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction causing neuromuscular junction instability and muscle atrophy, highlighting tissue-specific mitochondrial decline affecting motor units.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Oxidative Stress from Metabolic Dysregulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on cytosolic triglyceride-induced mitochondrial oxidative stress via ADP/ATP exchange inhibition, linking metabolic lipid overload to mitochondrial ROS and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Oxidative Damage Accumulation and Neuroprotection Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial oxidative damage accumulation in neurons and protective roles of melatonin, linking mitochondrial ROS to neurodegeneration and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Organ-Specific Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial DNA damage, ROS homeostasis, and dysregulated biogenesis/mitophagy in organ-specific aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Oxidative Stress and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS accumulation, energy production decline, and impaired quality control mechanisms like mitophagy in cardiac aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Oxidative Stress and Cardiac Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase decline, ROS increase, and antioxidant responses specifically in cardiac tissue aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Translational Control and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial protein synthesis regulation as a key aging determinant independent of oxidative stress and energy production.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction as a Hallmark of Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Frames mitochondrial dysfunction as a fundamental hallmark shared between mitochondrial diseases and normative aging, modifiable by pharmacological agents.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cardiac Mitochondrial Cytochrome c and Cardiolipin Depletion Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on selective depletion of cytochrome c and cardiolipin in cardiac mitochondria causing impaired respiration and accelerated cardiac aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial bc1 Complex Superoxide Production Reduction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes evolutionary adaptations in mitochondrial bc1 complex to reduce superoxide production, linking structural changes to longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Biogenesis and Dynamics Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights age-related decline in mitochondrial biogenesis regulators, oxidative stress, inflammation, and imbalance in mitochondrial fusion/fission.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation Accumulation and Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA mutations causing respiratory chain deficiency and cell loss, with a nuanced view on ROS involvement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS Production and Electron Transport Chain Dysfunction Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as causal aging agents, including roles of complex II mutations and electron leakage mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mitochondrial ROS production as a regulated process causing molecular damage and influencing species longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical Theory of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage and a vicious cycle of mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Protein Acetylation Modulation Theory of Longevity
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links calorie restriction-induced lifespan extension to changes in mitochondrial protein acetylation affecting metabolism and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitophagy and Mitochondrial Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitophagy as a key mitochondrial quality control mechanism whose impairment drives aging and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Free Radical and Intergenomic Conflict Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Combines mitochondrial ROS production with mitochondrial-nuclear genome interactions influencing aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Deletion-Prone Structure and Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on unusual mtDNA structures prone to deletions via oxidative damage and recombination, contributing to mitochondrial aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Oxidative Stress Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General theory linking mitochondrial functional decline and ROS accumulation to aging and age-related diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Maternal Mitochondrial Inheritance and Lifespan Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes maternal mitochondrial factors and oocyte mitochondrial decline as key determinants of offspring lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Decline in Epidermal Cells and Systemic Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links age-related mitochondrial number and function decline in skin cells to systemic aging phenotypes including obesity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Physical Activity Modulation of Mitochondrial Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Attributes mitochondrial aging largely to reduced physical activity, with exercise protecting mitochondrial function and delaying aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Deletion Mutation and Sarcopenia Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details accumulation of mtDNA deletions causing mitochondrial dysfunction, apoptosis, and muscle fiber loss contributing to sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Respiration-Driven Aging Control and ROS Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes cytochrome oxidase-dependent respiration influences aging via ROS production and energy metabolism affecting longevity.
